We track one of these men as he steps from the lead car a approaches the truck. The men circle around him. This is their leader -- DIETER VON CUNTH, 60, handsome, charming. Cunth is closely followed by CONSTANTINE BACH -- bald, no eyebrows, terrifying. Close behind them are HECTOR AND ED CULEBRA, both 39, two large, scary looking twins. Dieter steps forward, crushing a cigarette under his boot

dialogues.text: Open it. CLOSE ON: the back doors of the truck are opened to revea another set of doors with an elaborate alarm mechanism.

Through the smoke, we reveal sleek metal walls -- this is ordinary truck. Men in military uniforms are strewn unconscious on the floor. In the middle of the truck is a NUCLEAR MISSILE with the letters “X5T-337TVS” written on side.  Zeke whistles reverently.

dialogues.text: Stock footage of a military helicopter buzzing over beaut mountain ranges. Super: Rio Bamba, Ecuador

dialogues.text: Lieutenant Dixon Piper, 28, handsome, shouts over the noi of the chopper to Colonel James Faith, 50, distinguished.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Sir, I still don’t understand why we had to come all the way out here.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Because, Lieutenant. We need the best.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: This guy’s that good?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why can’t we stay inside the department?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: We need someone outside the system. Someone they’d never suspect.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: But sir, if this guy’s that good, won't they be tracking him?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Because... he’s been dead for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper and Faith are led through the majestic grounds by a small VILLAGE BOY. A bird caws in the distance. They arrive at a courtyard. Seated in front of a large BUDDHIST SHRINE, we find a MAN deep in meditation -- he w a sleeveless monk robe and sports a stringy mullet. Colonel Faith and Lieutenant Piper approach quietly. cU -- Faith's boot steps on a very small leaf.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Hello Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Hello MacGruber.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: (in awe) MacGruber?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: You forget, I taught you everything you know. From his seated position, MacGruber does a backflip onto feet.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Not everything, Colonel. MUSIC: there is a hint of a guitar wail Faith smiles. MacGruber approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber, this is Lieutenant Dixon Piper. Lieutenant, this is--

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: The legendary MacGruber. Former navy seal, army ranger and green beret. Served six tours in Desert Storm, four in Bosnia, three each in Angola, Somalia, Rwanda, Mozambique and Sierra Leone. Recipient of sixteen purple hearts, three Congressional Medals of Honor, seven presidential medals of bravery, and starting tight end for the University of Texas El Paso.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Don’t forget, expendable government pawn.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Mac, listen...

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Colonel, with all due respect, whatever it is you’re here for, the answer is no.

dialogues.text: MacGruber walks outside, surrounded by children. He softl pats them on their heads as they yammer in Spanish. Faith and Piper follow.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: My life is here now. Everything I care about is in these walls. I am aman of peace. This is my home. These are my people. One of the kids takes his watch and runs off.  MacGruber MacGruber

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Hey hey hey! He’1ll give it back.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Look, MacGruber... watches the kid run off.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Hang on... just wanna see where he is going... okay.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Two days ago, a Russian convoy was transporting a high level asset and got jacked. Yesterday, reliable sources informed us that the asset made its way to US soil.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Sorry Colonel, that’s not my problem anymore.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber... it’s the X5. is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: The X5 is one of the most powerful nuclear warheads in the--

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know what the X5 is.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Can you give us a moment? Piper reluctantly walks away. MacGruber

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Look Mac, you’re our only hope. We need you. Your country needs you. looks off.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I think I’ve given more than enough to my country already.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Mac, if this is about Casey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s not about Casey! It’s about a promise I made to myself.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber, listen.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: No, you listen! I’m out of the game!

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Well, the game has changed!

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: But the players are the same!

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber, it’s Cunth!

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: We have reason to believe that the X5 is now in the possession of Dieter Von Cunth. Now I don’t need to explain to you how dangerous a nuclear warhead can be in the hands of a man like Cunth.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Cunth.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber, this is your chance to finally take him down.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Jim. I can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: If you change your mind. Faith hands him a dossier and leaves.

dialogues.text: Very little, unfortunately. For the past ten years, we’ve been watching Cunth like a hawk, but he’s very good at keeping his hands clean. The guy doesn’t make mistakes. He’s too good.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER

dialogues.speaker: FAITH

dialogues.text: But they’1l be looking for those next.

dialogues.text: Oh, will they, Rookie?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: It is imperative that they do not get those passcodes.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna lie to you. This is a very tall order. Word on the street is that Cunth’s put together a team of the most ruthless criminals this planet has to offer. 12. Faith motions to a cork board with various pictures on it

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Hoss Bender, Zeke Pleshette, Constantine Bach, the Culebra twins. It’s a veritable dream team of killers.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Well, then I’1l just have to put together my own dream team... of killer stoppers.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Regarding that. Lieutenant Piper here is one of the best and brightest on the force. He’ll be your eyes and ears on this thing. MacGruber stares daggers at Piper.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I got a better idea: no fucking way. MacGruber storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper runs after MacGruber, Faith follows.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Look, MacGruber, I know I’m not what you expected --

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Let me guess, one year out of the academy, zero combat experience, little punk thinks his shit don’t stink.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Look, if you just give me a shot--

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Give this a shot.  13. MacGruber quickly whips around Piper’s back, jamming his against his back then smashes Piper's face into a desk, knocking him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Aaaggh! My freaking nose!

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Don’t ever pair me up with some piss ant, Faith. This mission is far too important for that. Now, if you’1l excuse me, it’s time to round up a real team.

dialogues.text: MacGruber! Thought you were dead! Frank jumps up and bear-hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER

dialogues.speaker: FRANK

dialogues.text: Be right there. MacGruber looks around. There are clocks of all different sizes and shapes on the walls. VICKI ST. ELMO, 32, beautiful, enters. When she sees MacGruber, she drops the clock she’s holding.

dialogues.text: I thought you were dead.

dialogues.text: So did I. But I’m not. I’m alive and I’m putting together a team.

dialogues.text: No, good for us. And good for America. And good for fans of justice and truth. Because you’re on that team.

dialogues.text: Sorry, MacGruber. I’m out of the game.

dialogues.text: Why do I have to be Hoss? MacGruber sits shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Because you’re good at what you do.  40. Piper sits in the back seat dressed up as MacGruber in hi clothes and wig.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: And why do I have to be you?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Look Piper, I’m running the show around here. So when I give an order, you will follow it with a smile on your face and a big “yes sir.” All right?

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: (smiles fakely) Yes sir. MacGruber points at him, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind industrial equipment, MacGruber, Vicki, and P scope out a warehouse. Two guards are on either side of t entrance, a third on the roof -- all have sub-machine gun

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Looks like there are three guards here and two at the south entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: So if we take these three guards out of the equation?

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Then it’s three on two, we’ll have the advantage.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Well, keep in mind, one of our three is a woman.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Thanks, MacGruber.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: No, I meant that in a good way. You count as like one and a half people. MacGruber shoots a look at Piper which shows that he does truly mean it.  41.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: So once we take out the guards, Vicki will drive in dressed as Hoss and we'll just see what happens. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: So we’re just gonna wing it?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: That’s the plan. Vicki has a look of terror on her face.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Again, that’s not a--

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Piper?! Piper smiles through gritted teeth.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s do this thing. Piper loads clips into two handguns and passes one to MacGruber.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: MacGrubie don’t play like homey. And homey don’t play like that.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: So it’s true what they say about you. You don’t use guns.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Guns are for the weak. Guns are for the stupid. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: But these men are trained soldiers.  42.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Look, you’re more than welcome to use your guns. But me? I’m gonna use this. MacGruber points to his brain, then looks inside a dumpst

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Let’s see, what do we got here? MacGruber grabs a bunch of things and places them in fron him. The items: a carrot, bug spray, copper wire, some brads, a tar shingle, a pine cone and a dirty old salad b

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Making a little distraction. MacGruber peels the carrot with his Swiss Army Knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three guards stand watch. Suddenly, an odd noise is heard echoing off the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? The guards look around, guns at the ready. The noises get louder. GUARD POV - looking left and right around the deserted ra yard, finally the camera pans up to find MacGruber on the roof of a small building, dancing around completely naked (except for his boots) with a carrot in his ass.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Now! Piper jumps up from behind a dumpster. He sees MacGruber is temporarily stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Now! Now! Piper finally snaps to it and shoots the three men with a silencer and then runs over to MacGruber.  43.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: I gotta admit, it worked.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you do have to admit it. And you know who else has to admit it? Those three dead guys.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: They’re dead because I shot them. As MacGruber gets dressed:

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Because they were distracted. Now, piece of advice, you ever try this, you’re gonna wanna go with the thick end -- seems counter- intuitive, but...

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Look, you're wasting your time. I’m never ever gonna do that.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Never ever say never ever. Okay, follow me. MacGruber and Piper sneak into the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Zeke and Constantine wait for Hoss, a BODYGUARD stands a Hummer protecting a MAN IN A SUIT who holds a BRIEFCASE From a catwalk, MacGruber and Piper look on.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: That’s Constantine Bach and Zeke Pleshette.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: And if I’m not mistaken -- which I never am -- that briefcase-carrying motherfuck has the passcodes. (into wrist mic) Okay Vicki, it’s go time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki waits in the Cadillac, still dressed as Hoss.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Do I really have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacGruber talks into wrist mic.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yes, Vicki, you really do. Now start that car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki reluctantly starts the car and drives slowly toward warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacGruber talks into the wrist mic.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Vicki, America thanks you for your bravery. And if for some reason, you don’t make it out of this, at some point, I’1l let America know what you did today and I’m sure you'll get a posthumous medal, or a certificate at the very least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki drives, freaked out as MacGruber continues talking.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And I will make sure you get a full military burial. Got ‘em for those other guys, I can get one for you. Okay, I can see your lights now. Just keep driving in slowly and let’s see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacGruber leans over to Piper.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: This is so exciting.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki's very close to the entrance now. MacGruber continu

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now head through the entrance. Slowly. Don’t worry. Remember, they think you’re Hoss Bender so it’s gonna take them a little-- The moment the car enters:

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: That’s not Hoss! The men immediately spray the car with bullets. Vicki duc down, puts the car in reverse, slams her foot on the accelerator, and hauls ass out of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: From the catwalk, Piper opens fire on the men. He shoots kills the bodyguard as MacGruber starts to mix some sort concoction together in the salad bowl.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Making a homemade grenade! Constantine opens fire on the catwalk. Piper manages to k the man with the briefcase. Zeke grabs the case and runs.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Can I borrow your gun? I need something to stir this with!

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: No, I’m using it right now! Use your finger!

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Watch your fucking tone! Piper aims at ZEKE and pulls the trigger: CLICK! No bulle

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Shit! From an ANKLE HOLSTER Piper draws a .38 SNUB NOSE revolve aims at Zeke in the distance, takes a deep breath and... BLAM! Shoots Zeke in the head, killing him.  46. Constantine grabs the case and slips out of the warehouse Piper chases after him. MacGruber follows, stirring the ingredients in the bowl with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper and MacGruber run to the back entrance just in time see Constantine jump into a car and speed away. Piper fir at him but he’s too far away. MacGruber takes a gooey pine cone out of the bowl, takes match out of his vest pocket, lights the pine cone and th throws it in the direction of the car. But the pine cone only goes about twenty feet and then stops. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! That’s why you can’t stir with your finger, cuz then your hand’s too sticky to get ina good throw.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Oh God, Vicki! The guys sprint away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race to the crashed Cadillac. They fling open the do to find Vicki, crouched inside, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Vicki! Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just a little shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Well, shake it off, tough lady, we got work to do. Let’s skedaddle.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t we check the dead guys for clues?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Yes.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the dead men are laid out side by side.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: This cell phone is all we got.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Then we better make the most of it. Because at this point, this is our only connection to the passcodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surveillance van drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacGruber drives. Vicki sits shotgun. Piper’s in the back MacGruber lifts up a carrot and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Gross.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I washed it. In the rearview mirror, MacGruber shoots a look at Piper which shows that he doesn’t truly mean it. SFX: cell phone ring

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Is that tracer hooked up?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Set to jet, MacGruber. MacGruber grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I just hope I can keep this guy on the phone long enough to get a location on him.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: What are you gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I'll figure something out. (into phone) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACGRUBER (cont'd) Listen to me, you piece of shit. Hoss and Zeke are dead and if you don’t tell me who this is--he hung up. You get it?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Damn it. Is that thing working?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Yes. But you have to keep them on for at least twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Sorry, lost my cool. I just want this so badly.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Well, next time, just think about how badly you want it and then Maybe you won’t lose your temper.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: You're right. Maybe he’1ll call back.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: (furious) Shit! I am so fucking stupid! MacGruber’s phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Haha! Second chance. In your face! (he picks up) Listen to me, you piece of shit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith at his desk. (Intercut with MacGruber)

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: MacGruber, it’s Faith.  49.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Colonel! How’s it going? (whispered, to Vicki) It’s my phone.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: What's the mission status?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Mission status? Uh, fuckin’ great.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: So you've got some leads?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yep. Lots. What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Not much on our end. We know Cunth is having a fundraiser in his home.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yeah, that is a shitty lead. That’s next week, right?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: No, it’s tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yep, yep, tonight. Casual dress, right?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: No. It’s actually a formal affair.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yep, formal affair, tonight, exact same intel we had.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Got any other leads?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: We got some leads that are gonna blow your fucking mind.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Great, I’m gonna conference in the President.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Oh shit, oh shit. Ate something bad. Gotta go. Hoooahhh. (hangs up) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACGRUBER (cont'd) That was close. He was gonna put the President on, pretty cool huh?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: So Cunth is having a party?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yeah. And guess who just made the guest list? Camera moves in dramatically on MacGruber’s intense face.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Guess who just made the guest list?

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yes. EXT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- NIGHT Super: Cunth Mansion, Salt Lake City, Utah, USA Soft rock blares as the Miata door opens. White cowboy bo hit the pavement. Pan up a white tux with country piping see MacGruber. MacGruber gives his keys to a valet, pulls out his stereo walks to the front door where he’s greeted by a MAN IN A

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A TUX
dialogues.text: Sir, do you have your invitation?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, sure. It’s right... MacGruber searches his pockets, but instead of a ticket, presents to the man his hand, middle finger sticking out.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: ..-here. He then walks on by and into the party. INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- NIGHT MacGruber walks by a COAT CHECK GIRL.  51.

dialogues.speaker: COAT CHECK GIRL
dialogues.text: Can I take your coat? Your car stereo?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Nice try. (into wrist mic) Piper, I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper monitors from the van.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: MacGruber, keep in mind, you wanna keep a low profile here. INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Sorry Piper, low profile isn’t in my vocabulary. Pounding Cunth on the other hand--

dialogues.speaker: PIPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Where’s Vicki?

dialogues.speaker: PIPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She arrived ten minutes ago. She’s in the banquet hall. MacGruber sees a closed door and starts for it.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I’ll find her in a sec. First I got a little business to attend to. INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- LIVING ROOM -- NIGHT A quartet plays classical music as MacGruber scans the ro searching for Vicki. The floor is crowded with people in tuxedos and elegant dresses. The crowd parts. Passionate music swells as we pan up Vicki to see some sh sensible shoes and a moderately-priced, flowy white pants and faux pearls. MacGruber is stunned by her beauty.  52.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Sorry, just took an upper decker in the master bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: An upper decker?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: It’s where you take a dump in the water tank and not in the bowl. You look great.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Uh... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Piper, got a location on Cunth?

dialogues.speaker: PIPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He appears to be in the east wing.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: On my way. He starts away. Vicki grabs his hand and pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: Don’t do anything stupid. MacGruber smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: You know me. INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- DRAWING ROOM -- NIGHT Cunth is engaged in a high stakes game of poker -- a BEAUTIFUL YOUNG WOMAN stands behind him. There is only on other player left in the game, JURGEN KRAUSS, 65.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: I’1l see your twenty thousand and raise you forty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s bluffing. Cunth looks up from his cards to see his old nemesis.  53.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I can tell by the look in his beady little eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: MacGruber. I’ve been expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Bet’s to you, Mr. Krauss. Krauss looks at MacGruber and then to his cards and pushe huge stack of chips into the center.

dialogues.speaker: MR. KRAUSS
dialogues.text: I’m all in.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Mr. Krauss is all in for two hundred fifty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Call. They flip over their cards.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Straight flush.

dialogues.speaker: MR. KRAUSS
dialogues.text: Fuck! Mr. Krauss walks off, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. I really thought he was bluffing.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Thank you, MacGruber. You just made me a teeny tiny bit wealthier than I already am.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I’m sure you’ll do something useful with it. Your companion’s a very beautiful young woman. (to woman) Hope you like being date raped, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: This is my daughter.  54.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Hello. Sorry, he killed my wife.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Honey, could you give us a few moments? Cunth’s daughter rolls her eyes and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Where’s the X5?

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Where is the fucking warhead?

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: What would I want with a nuclear warhead?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I never said it was nuclear.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Sorry, you're right. Most warheads are filled with air.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: You know, I ran into Zeke Pleshette and Hoss Bender the other day.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Really? And how were they?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: A lot less dead than they are now.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Hm, that’s too bad.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Too bad for you. Cuz they were part of your little dream team of thugs, weren’t they?

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Yes, they were -- past tense. Very sad story actually.  55.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: I had assembled the greatest team of bad guys this world has ever seen and I had them all in this room and I had forgotten that I had some C4 in there and wouldn’t you know it, the whole place exploded and I lost them all.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: You're shitting me. You are shitting me. Well, we have a lot in common because I...

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Oh no, wait, that didn’t happen to me because I’m not a fucking retard who blows up his own dudes.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Cunth! And by the way, I have a new team now -- that’s right. Not only do I have the best timer in the business, but also one of the greatest young military minds around. I mean, this guy’s the real deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piper smiles. That was nice of MacGruber to say. INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- DRAWING ROOM -- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: ...and we are gonna stop you.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: You have a very healthy imagination, MacGruber. I certainly do not have a warhead, nuclear or otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: You're lying. And you’re a piece of shit. Cunth rises to leave.  56.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: That’s enough here. Gentlemen, please show Mr. MacGruber the door. Three LARGE HENCHMEN surround MacGruber.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Let me tell you how this is gonna go down. First I’m gonna kick you in the chin, breaking your jaw in four places, then I’m gonna take you and karate flip you over my back and then knee your nose into your brain, killing you instantly. I do wanna get a throat rip in here somehow -- think that’s gonna be you, small fry. One disclaimer, the order is subject to change depending on my whim. But one thing I do know -- at the end of the day, Cunth, I’m gonna rip your dick off and shove it in your mouth and that is non-negotiable. So who's first? EXT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- NIGHT MacGruber gets thrown out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Ah shit! My fucking back. Moments later, his car stereo gets thrown out too.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! That’s a Blaupunkt! You owe me a Blaupunkt! INT. CUNTH’S MANSION -- LATER Cunth, still dressed in party attire, bursts through a se double doors followed by a henchman.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Dammit! How the hell did he get in here?! Want to explain that to me?

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: He walked in the front door, sir.  57.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Well, La Di Da! He walked in the front door! Cunth notices the henchman’s finger is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: What happened to your finger?

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: He tried to bite my hand off. A drop of blood falls to the floor. Cunth looks at it and then at the henchman.

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry sir. The henchman puts his glass of water on the table and the goes to clean up the blood.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Coaster.

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, yes sir. The henchman places a coaster under the glass, then bends down to clean up the blood. There is a knock at the door. Cunth takes a swig of scotch.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Come the fuck in! Constantine and the Culebra twins enter.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Oh great, it’s Team Dickhead. God damn it, shoes!

dialogues.speaker: EDWIN/HECTOR/CONSTANTINE
dialogues.text: Sorry./Sorry sir./Sorry. The three of them remove their shoes and carry them.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANTINE
dialogues.text: You wanted to see us, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: I will not have ten years of work and planning go up in flames because of that asshole. Let me be very clear, I want MacGruber dead. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUNTH (cont'd) You do remember how to do that, right? It’s very easy, you just take out your gun, aim it and fire. Cunth takes out his gun and shoots the henchman in the he His brains splatter all over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: That isn’t so hard, is it? Now go. Constantine and the twins exit with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: CUNTH
dialogues.text: Somebody get this guy’s brains off my fucking wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Faith rips into MacGruber.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: How in the world did you think it would be a good idea to go there?

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I wanted Cunth to know I was onto him.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Well, he knows all right.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: I got him exactly where I want him.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Do you? Cuz I think it’s the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Agree to disagree, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: In case you’ve forgotten, I am your superior officer and you will address me as such.

dialogues.speaker: MACGRUBER
dialogues.text: Yes, Colonel. Look, I’m really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Sorry is not going to keep us safe from this goddamn warhead! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

INT. CUNTH’S COMPOUND -- X5 LAUNCH SITE -- NIGHT Cunth waits to die.
Suddenly, he sees something: in the corner of the room is axe. His eyebrows raise. EXT. CUNTH’S COMPOUND -- NIGHT MacGruber, Vicki and Piper throw open the door and sprint away from the compound!
